title: Tattoo
alt: I calculate that the electrons in radiation therapy hit you at 99.8% of the speed of light, and the beam used in a 90-second gamma ray therapy session could, if fired with less precision, kill a horse (they did not let me test this).
transcript:
[Megan is in the panel. Megan points at her chest.]
Megan: I just have one tattoo - it's six dots on my chest, done by my oncologist.Megan: I need them for aligning the laser sights on a flesh-searing relativistic particle cannon,Megan: So it will only kill the parts of me[Dramatic zoom, the panel background is black, with white text.]
Megan: That are holding me back.[The panel is larger, revealing who they're talking to.]
Megan: But your barbed wire bicep tattoo is pretty hardcore, too!
Cueball: No, it's OK.  I'll just go put a shirt on.
